title: Violence, nudity and demonic possession: why Hollywood’s biggest blockbusters are banned in China
text:
China is one of the biggest box-office markets. It already has more cinema screens than the US, and is projected within the next few years to raise more ticket revenue too.

Yet it operates a highly restrictive system in which very few films from foreign countries are allowed to be distributed. The latest to fall foul is Quentin Tarantino’s Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, the critical darling starring Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt. It was due for a Chinese release next week, but has now been turned down.
